history.content:
Current 188 TA, have not taken 159 but read the syllabus and heard about it from friends. IMP they are supposed to be very different classes. 188 focuses more on general techniques of approaching different tasks in AI, and is a much more mathy course (a lot of probability in the second half), while 159 is a more comprehensive overview of the techniques specially used in NLP, and the exams are more conceptual (according to my friends).

Regarding to workload, I do not know much about 159. IMP the workload of 188 merely a little heavier than 61A, and much lighter than almost all the CS upper divs. Survey data available on the HKN website can be somewhat helpful in comparing the workload between courses, though it also depends a lot on individual background.

I will assume 159 to be more useful in industry as it targets on a specific field. The projects for 188 are somewhat light, and the focus for 188 also lies more on classical AI algorithms than the stuff behind the buzz words that you may expect (only 2 weeks on MDP+RL and 1 week on neural networks).

I'm trying to decide whether I want to take CS 188 or Info 159 alongside CS 161 and CS 168 this semester. Topics in both courses seem to have a little bit of overlap. Does anyone have any input comparing the two courses, especially regarding workload and usefulness in industry? Thanks!
history.subject: CS 188 vs Info 159
